title: Introducing: Pauwel De Meyer
content:
Having already supported Benjamin Francis Leftwich and released one EP as well as his debut album What Do They Do With Boys Like Us last year, it’s a crime that Belgian singer-songwriter Pauwel De Meyer isn’t already a household name.

Now prepping his sophomore record, entitled Hideaway, it’s a record that’s sure to expose his music to an even wider audience. A heartfelt mix of Elliott Smith and Conor Oberst album opener I Can Do That bares all from the off, lamenting drunken nights and disillusioned love all delivered in the soothing tones of De Meyer.

So the singer-songwriter market is hardly starved at the moment, yet it’s certainly lacking on the talent side of things, with a vast proportion of artists writing for their audience as oppose to transferring their own emotional output into music. It’s this honesty that De Meyer expresses so freely, even when the tracks take a slicker angle, such as Do You Remember, an out-and-out piano ballad, that comes across far more Perfume Genius than Daniel Powter, and is all the more enjoyable for it. Check out a couple of my favourites from Hideaway below.
